org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy

Class Proxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.Proxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(urlPatterns="/proxy/*")
public class Proxy
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    A servlet that proxies HTTP requests to another server and handles the response.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse,
                      java.net.URI targetObject)

        Parameters:

        servletResponse - the HTTP servlet response
        targetObject - the target URI object

      • authorizeProxyRequest

        private ProxyRequest authorizeProxyRequest(ProxyRequest proxyRequest)
        Authorize the request based on the information in the ProxyRequest DTO. Change anything in the proxy request that needs changing based on the authorization results.
        Parameters:
        proxyRequest - the proxy request to authorize
        Returns:
        the modified proxy request

      • sendRequestToServer

        private void sendRequestToServer(org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest request,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                       org.apache.http.client.ResponseHandler<java.lang.String> responseHandler)
                          throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                                 java.io.IOException

        Send the HTTP request to the target server. Set the appropriate cookie for session handling.

        PB-128: The client must not do any redirect handling; it should leave that to the actual client browser.

        Parameters:
        request - the URI request to send to the server
        session - the HTTP session containing a possible cookie store
        responseHandler - the response handler for the request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem handling the URI or redirecting
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException - when there is a syntax error in the URI

      • redirectToRefusedUri

        private void redirectToRefusedUri(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                        ProxyRequest proxyRequest,
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
                           throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Redirect to the redirect URI previously set.
        Parameters:
        response - the HTTP servlet response
        proxyRequest - the current proxy request
        session - HTTP session
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - when there is a problem setting the response or no redirect URI was found

      • configureProxyRequest

        private void configureProxyRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                         ProxyRequest proxyRequest,
                         org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest requestToProxy)
        Configure the various settings in the proxy request: the proxy request itself, the redirect context, the request headers, and the forwarded header.
        Parameters:
        servletRequest - the HTTP servlet request
        proxyRequest - the proxy request to configure
        requestToProxy - the HTTP request to proxy to the target

      • rewriteUriFromString

        private java.lang.String rewriteUriFromString(java.lang.String uriString,
                                    java.lang.String originalHost)
                                       throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Rewrite a URI in string format to go to a specific host. The returned string preserves the path, query, and fragment of the original URI, just changing the host to the specified host.
        Parameters:
        uriString - the original URI as a string
        originalHost - the host to which to rewrite the URI
        Returns:
        the rewritten URI
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the original URI has a syntax problem

      • getHost

        private java.lang.String getHost()
        Get the host to which to proxy.
        Returns:
        the host name as a string

      • proxy

        private void proxy(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse,
         ProxyRequest proxyRequest)
            throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Proxy the request.
        Parameters:
        session - the HTTP session, for setting the cookie store
        servletResponse - the servlet response to send to the client
        proxyRequest - the proxy request
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - when there is a servlet problem, including URI syntax or handling issues

      • copyProxyResponseToServletResponse

        private void copyProxyResponseToServletResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                      org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Copy the response headers and entity to the servlet response.
        Parameters:
        response - the HTTP servlet response to return to the client
        proxyResponse - the response from the proxy target
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem copying the headers or entity

      • closeQuietly

        protected void closeQuietly(java.io.Closeable closeable)
        Close a closeable without throwing any IO exceptions.
        Parameters:
        closeable - the closeable to close.

      • copyResponseHeaders

        protected void copyResponseHeaders(org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Copy proxied response headers back to the servlet client. Skip any hop-by-hop headers or cookies. Stripping cookies ensures that no cookies set between the Proxy and Target servers affects the cookies sent from Proxy to Client.
        Parameters:
        proxyResponse - the proxied server response
        response - the servlet response

      • copyResponseEntity

        protected void copyResponseEntity(org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Copy response body data (the entity) from the proxy to the servlet client. Ignore any errors. PB-191: rewrote to use stream approach.
        Parameters:
        proxyResponse - the response from the proxied server
        response - the servlet response

      • getIpAddress

        public static java.lang.String getIpAddress(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the remote IP address of the requester from the request. This method gets, in order, the Remote_Addr header value, the x-forwarded-for header value, or the HTTP request remote address.
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP servlet request containing the IP address
        Returns:
        the remote IP address
